title: Cross section determination of short-to-medium lived nuclides in a low power research and an Am-Be neutron source

x4freetext: HPGe coaxial detector (ORTEC), which has a
relative efficiency of 25% and energy resolution of
1.8 keV at 1332.5 keV gamma-ray of Co-60.

x4freetext: Arsenic standard solution which contained 10% nitric

x4codes.hlp: National Nuclear Research Institute, Legon, Ghana

x4freetext: Ghana Research Reactor-1 is a 30 kW tank-in-pool
reactor, which uses 90.2% enriched uranium-Al alloy
as fuel. The samples were irradiated at thermal
power level of 3 kW and 15 kW.
The spectral parameter and thermal to epithermal flux
ratio were determined by Cadmium ratio method using
Measured epithermal neutron shaping factor (alpha) at
the outer  and inner irradiation channels:

x4headers.headerHelp: Energy of incident projectile, laboratory system
Value of quantity specified under REACTION
Error in value of quantity, defined under ERR-ANALYS

neutron emission is quoted as 2.2x10*6 n/cm/Ci.

channels 1 and 2 of the Am-Be neutron source:
